pullRequest.title: [DOCS] Clarify impact of objective on class scores
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR alters the information about interpreting classification results (https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/machine-learning/master/dfa-classification.html#dfa-classification-interpret) such that it describes the impact of the class_assignment_objective on the class_score.
Preview
https://stack-docs_1374.docs-preview.app.elstc.co/guide/en/machine-learning/master/dfa-classification.html#dfa-classification-interpret

beforeCommit.message: [DOCS] Add impact of objective on class_score

afterCommit.message: [DOCS] Add impact of objective on class_score

commit.message: [DOCS] Add impact of objective on class_score

afterCommit.message: [DOCS] Add impact of objective on class_score

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -114,45 +114,64 @@ in the `analyzed_fields` object when configuring the {dfanalytics-job}.
 == Interpreting {classification} results
 
 The following sections help you understand and interpret the results of a 
-{classanalysis}.
+{classanalysis}. To see example results, refer to
+<<flightdata-classification-results>>.
 
 [[dfa-classification-class-probability]]
 === `class_probability`
 
-The value of `class_probability` shows how likely it is that a given data point 
-belongs to a certain class. It is a value between 0 and 1. The higher the 
-number, the higher the probability that the data point belongs to the named 
-class. This information is stored in the `top_classes` array for each document 
-in your destination index. See the
-{ml-docs}/flightdata-classification.html#flightdata-classification-results[Viewing {classification} results]
-section in the {classification} example.
+The `class_probability` is a value between 0 and 1, which indicates how likely
+it is that a given data point belongs to a certain class.
+////
+//TMI?
+For each data point, {classanalysis} applies the
+inverse of the {wikipedia}/Logit(logit function) to the logarithm of the
+odds that were predicted by the decision forest.
+////

commit.message: [DOCS] Remove comments and fix image width
